intro: Cecropia mexicana f. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leaved ceiba, is a fast-growing tree native to southern Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically reaches heights of 10–20 meters and has a straight, buttressed trunk, which helps it thrive in humid tropical environments. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds. This species is often found in lowland tropical forests and is valued for its ecological role in providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
